result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were canceled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jose A. Arroyo - Guevara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jose A. Arroyo - Guevara is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jose A. Arroyo - Guevara was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.    Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  **Pay fine of $300.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges & DV Surcharge of $100 for each count.
Sumbit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
**Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  May Not have contact with Yolanda Sanchez-Lopez unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  May have contact with his son.  Review hearing on 2/19/16 @ 8:45

records.addlTxt: Per DOC refund DOC payments back to Deft;  jk/mg  ck#16CH076246
Emailed DOC cashier's office regarding refund of court obligations paid through DOC - per Cashier's Office refund deft directly
$50 due in 30 days or civil judgment.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty John Cabranes and interpreter Leo Martin - sworn.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  147 - ST reports DE has already plead to these charges, however, they were reversed due to immigration issues. DE enters plea of guilty as to Ct3 (DV enhancer stricken on ST's motion) - found guilty by the court. Cts 1, 2 dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations made. Court orders a $50 fine, due in 30 days or civil judgment. Costs waived. Appeal rights given.
from DA - Reply/ Answer to defendant"s Discovery Demand State's Reciprocal Demand  ADA J Zapf.
Court vacates original plea and dispisition entered by the DE.
All payments/bonds have been adjusted off of financial obligations
of hearing on 3/16/16

REINSTATED
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ Yolanda S-L or her residence
940.30 - False Imprisonment  D/V  - 940.19(1) - Battery  D/V  - 947.01(1) - D.C.  D/V

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty John Cabranes and interpreter, Ruth Garcia - sworn.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  820 - Atty Cabranes moves to vacate plea previously entered on grounds of factually incorrect information being given by the former attorney - Padilla Motion. ST stipulates to DE's Padilla Motion. Court vacates original plea and disposition entered by DE. Atty Cabranes to draft an order to that effect. Court orders $3000 signature bond previously set be reinstated with all conditions continuing.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

MINUTES:  940 - Parties request adjournment due to some deportation issues - granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:15am.

records.addlTxt: Spanish interpreter requested for 2/19/16 hearing.

10:55 a.m. - Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Atty John Cabranes appeared for def.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. did not appear; appearance waived.  Case called at 10:55 a.m. instead of 3:00 p.m.  Parties are working on resolving the issues re the motion to vacate plea.  Status conf. 2/19/16 at 8:45.  Bond continued.
Motion hearing at 10-28-2015 03:00 pm

State is requesting 9/2/2015 Motion hearing be rescheduled to allow additional time to review the motion.  Attorney Cabranes does not object.  Motion hearing is rescheduled to 10/28/2015 at 3pm.  Interpreter, Leo Martin, was present.  NTBS by the Court.

And certificate of appearace for 
Atty Don Bielski for 9/2/15 @ 2 p.m. - before Judge Wilk - filed by Atty J Cabranes.
of Jose A. Arroyo Guevarra
to Vacate Conviction & Plea in the Interests of Justice or in the Alternative to Vacate Conviction & Plea Due to Ineffectiveness of Counsel - filed by Attorney John Cabranes
filed by Attorney John Cabranes    (9/2/2015 at 2pm)
2/4/15 - Plea Hearing
Last name of deft is:  Arroyo-Guevara.
For Cts 2 & 3 only

Defendant, Jose A. Arroyo, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski. Interpreter Leo Martin in court for DE; Interpreter Alberto Aguilar in court for victim. Attorney Michael David Graveley appeared for the Prosecution. Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Interpreters sworn in. Victim in court and gave and impact statement. Deportation warnings given. Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1 False Imprisonment, Domestic Abuse, Ct 2 Battery, Domestic Abuse and Ct 3 D.C., Dom Abuse; found guilty by the court. Court orders withheld sentence on Cts 2 & 3; defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions. 2 days sentence credit if revoked. Judgment withheld on Ct 1; if hold open agreement is completed, ST will dismiss Ct 1 dismissed. Fine of 300.00 plus costs on Ct 2. Court costs ordered. No restitution requested. Appeal rights given.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Hold Open Agreement for 12 months.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Donald Bielski and w/ Spanish interpreter, Leo Martin.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:41pm-  Interpreter sworn-in.  Victim rights compliance - victim is present.  Matter is resolved.  Court adjourns matter to have an interpreter present for the DE and a different interpreter available for the victim.  Plea hearing adjourned to February 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Donald Bielski and w/ Spanish interpreter, Leo Martin.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2pm-  Interpreter sworn-in.  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Bielski is requesting an adjournment to discuss an offer from the State w/ the DE.  Matter should be resolved at the next hearing.  Court grants request.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Bond continued.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Donald Bielski and w/ Spanish interpreter, Alberto Aguilar.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  1:51pm-  Victim rights compliance.  For reasons set forth on the record, Court adjourns matter to November 12, 2014 at 02:00 pm.  Bond continued.

Judicial pretrial on 10-1-14 @ 1:30pm. Bond continued.
